fields.description: iOS TableView objects already support delete style rows and supporting insert style rows is trivial.
fields.summary: iOS: Support Insert style rows in TableViews
fields.environment:
[INFO] Titanium SDK version: 1.8.0.1 (12/22/11 13:09 fbdc96f)
[INFO] iPhone SDK version: 5.0

comments.body:
TC-2892 has been resolved as a duplicate of this ticket but it contains useful information and a pull request that would be useful in the context of this ticket.

Blog post: http://blog.codexlabs.com/blog/2013/08/31/uitableviewcelleditingstyleinsert-is-now-a-pull-request-for-titanium-mobile/
Community pull request: https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/pull/4636
Q&A Discussion: https://developer.appcelerator.com/question/140226/add-row-row-in-editable-tableview

it seems like the momentum on this is dead. 
This API is still current in iOS7 and there's no indication that iOS8 will deprecate it:

https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/uikit/reference/UITableViewCell_Class/Reference/Reference.html


Maybe at this point it would make more sense to just wrap the SWTableViewCell repo on github:

https://github.com/CEWendel/SWTableViewCell
